Spherez wrote:

Any chance we can get the DVDR?
-------------------------------------------
Not to sound dumb, but I am not sure what that is.  I have the disk and I converted it to AVI, but to make a DVDR, I am not sure the proccess.

afoulks12: "Not to sound dumb, but I am not sure what that is. I have the disk and I converted it to AVI, but to make a DVDR, I am not sure the proccess."

Download DVDRip, rip the DVD to hard drive - without region code, then upload the files.

That'll be a 8 GB upload though. So the next step, should you choose to take it, is to use DVDShrink on the rip to reduce the size to about 4.3 GB, so it can fit on a single layer DVD.

Probably shouldn't do this if you don't have good upload bandwidth. At least 1 Megabit/sec, preferably > 2 Megabit / sec.

afoulks12: "Not to sound dumb, but I am not sure what that is. I have the disk and I converted it to AVI, but to make a DVDR, I am not sure the proccess."

It's pretty easy, though a little time consuming.

Download DVDRip, rip the DVD to hard drive - without region code, then upload the files.

That'll be a 8 GB upload though. So the next step, should you choose to take it, is to use DVDShrink on the rip to reduce the size to about 4.3 GB, so it can fit on a single layer DVD.

Probably shouldn't do this if you don't have good upload bandwidth. At least 1 Megabit/sec, preferably > 2 Megabit / sec.

Picture quality is pretty good... has been cropped top and bottom by a few pixels ..(maybe 10?) so the scrolling screener text at the bottom only shows top half.
Sound is not so good... it's been compressed quite a lot, or badly... so there is phasing in the upper-mid and higher frequencies. This becomes a bit annoying, for me at least being a bit of an audiophile.
